H0.text: A girl hitting a ball with a bat is an example where an object moves because of the force of gravity.

H1.text: A boy pushing a box across the floor is an example of an object moving because of the force of gravity.

H2.text: A girl hammering a nail into a wall is an example where an object moves because of the force of gravity.

H3.text: A boy falling from a tree onto the ground moves because of the force of gravity.

A4.text: In classical mechanics, free fall is any motion of a body where gravity is the only force acting upon it.

A5.text: Standing on the ground: the gravitational force is counteracted by the normal force from the ground.
